sentences.en: ...an infection popularly called mad cow disease.
...the Mesozoic era, more popularly known as the age of dinosaurs.
Amulets, " guards, " as they are popularly called , intended to ward off evil spirits.
sentences.cn: 护身符――或者象他们普遍的叫法:“警卫 ” 用来抵御妖魔鬼怪.

sentences.en: As popularly elected House , D á il Eireann enjoys supremacy over the Seanad.
sentences.cn: 作为全民选举的议院,众议院比参议院享有更多的优势.

sentences.en: Flexible resource is popularly existing in the process of enterprise operation.
sentences.cn: 柔性资源客观地存在于企业经营运作的各个环节.

sentences.en: He was popularly regarded as a great authority on phonetics.
sentences.cn: 他被普遍认为是语音学方面的大权威.

sentences.en: He works in a state - owned enterprise with a popularly - run nature.
sentences.cn: 他在一家国有民营的企业工作.

sentences.en: Moreover, it's popularly used as the poor man's cure - all.
sentences.cn: 此外, 大蒜还被广泛地用作穷人的万灵丹.

sentences.en: Nowadays computer assisted instruction is popularly applied in China's secondary schools.
sentences.cn: 计算机辅助教学在当今中国的中学应用十分广泛.

sentences.en: One never - to - be - forgotten encounter was the 2002 final, popularly known as the Centenariazo.
sentences.cn: 一次最难以忘怀的交锋上演在2002的决赛赛场上 —— 被人们成为世纪对决.

sentences.en: Schizophrenia is not a "split mind" as is popularly believed.
sentences.cn: 精神分裂症并非人们普遍认为的那样是“分裂的精神”。

sentences.en: She possessed the vibrant personality that is so often popularly associated with Spanish women.
sentences.cn: 她拥有通常会令人联想到西班牙女性的火热个性。

sentences.en: The true meaning of money yet remains to be popularly explained and comprehended.
sentences.cn: 关于金钱的真正意义,还有待人们的解释和理解.

sentences.en: They compete with Microsoft offers like Office , a hugely popularly popular product.
sentences.cn: 他们与微软的Office这一应用极广的产品竞争.

sentences.en: This capital is popularly known in China as bureaucrat - capital.
sentences.cn: 这个资本,在中国的通俗名称,叫做 官僚资本 .

words.tran_cn: 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的
流行音乐；汽水；砰然声；枪击
普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎
大众化的人；普及读物；普及者；使普及的人
突然出现；爆开；射击；瞪大；发出爆裂声
推广，普及；使…通俗化（等于popularize）；使…受欢迎
取出；开枪打；抛出；突然伸出；突然行动
流行地；通俗地；普及地；大众地

trans.tran_cn: 一般地，广泛地，大众地，通俗地，“popular”的派生
trans.tran_en: If something or someone is popularly known as something, most people call them that, although it is not their official name or title
